content.title: Education Loan Scheme under NSFDC- Haryana
content.department: Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC)
content.details: The scheme 'Education Loan Scheme under NSFDC' is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Scheduled Castes Finance & Development Corporation (NSFDC). This scheme offers educational loans of up to ₹10 lakhs for studies within India and up to ₹30 lakhs for studies abroad. These loans are available to eligible students pursuing regular full-time recognized courses in India or abroad.
benefits: Maximum Loan Limit for studies within India: Up to ₹10,00,000/-
Maximum Loan Limit for studies abroad: Up to ₹30,00,000/-
Recovery (Principal & Interest) will commence after 6 months of completion of the course or getting employment, whichever is earlier.
Loan repayment in 20 quarterly installments over 5 years from the date of first disbursement.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste Community.
The applicant's age should be between 18 and 45 years.
The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.
These loans are available to students pursuing regular full-time recognized professional/technical courses in India or abroad.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Applicants can apply through the official website of Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation or the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: A certificate from the Indian embassy Consulate on confirmation of admission given to the applicant
Resident Proof/Address Proof i.e. Ration Card
Accreditation status of the Course for which loan is to be availed in case of abroad study
Accreditation status of the Educational institution for which the loan is to be availed
Approval or Clearance Certificate from Competent Authority if Required only above Loan Cases of ₹1,00,000/-
Copy of admission confirmation from an educational institute with fee and other charges payment schedule yearly
Copy of Foreign exchange permit if applicable
A copy of the Identity card issued by the Institute if admission has already been taken
Copy of passport or visa number etc. if studying abroad
Copy of school leaving certificate in support of date of birth
A copy of the prospectus of the course for which the loan is sought
Loan Application form duly filled up or SC Certificate
SC Certificate from the competent authority

faqs.question: Who implements the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Scheduled Castes Finance & Development Corporation (NSFDC).

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to extend loans to eligible Scheduled Caste students for pursuing full-time professional or technical education.

faqs.question: What expenses does the education loan cover?
faqs.answer: The education loan covers admission fees, tuition fees, books, stationery, instruments, examination fees, boarding and lodging expenses, insurance premiums, travel expenses for studying abroad, caution money, and development funds.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount for studies within India?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount for studies within India is ₹10 lakhs.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount for studies abroad?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount for studies abroad is ₹30 lakhs.

faqs.question: When does the recovery of the loan start?
faqs.answer: Recovery of the loan (principal and interest) starts after 6 months of course completion or getting employment, whichever is earlier.

faqs.question: How is the loan repaid?
faqs.answer: The loan is repaid in 20 quarterly installments over 5 years from the date of the first disbursement.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the loan?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Haryana who belong to the Scheduled Caste community, aged between 18 and 45 years, with an annual family income not exceeding ₹3 lakhs, are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Can students pursuing integrated courses apply for the loan?
faqs.answer: Yes, students who secure admission in integrated courses covering both diploma/graduate and postgraduate levels can apply.

faqs.question: Is there a tag or marker on the student's degree indicating loan repayment liabilities?
faqs.answer: Yes, there would be a tag or marker on the student's diploma/degree indicating their repayment liabilities.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the loan?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the official portal, Antyodaya-SARAL Portal or the official website of Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation.

faqs.question: Is the loan available for both diploma and postgraduate studies?
faqs.answer: Yes, the loan is available for diploma, graduation, and postgraduate levels, but only once per student.

faqs.question: Can students apply for loans for short-term courses?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is for regular full-time recognized professional/technical courses only.
